description: Largest subset of integers [ 1...n ] such that no member divides two others.
references: R. K. Guy, Unsolved Problems Number Theory, B24.
formula: a(n) >= ceiling(2n/3). For large n, 0.6725n <= a(n) <= 0.6736n (see Guy).
example: {6,8-17,19-23,25-29} is the largest set of positive integers <= 29 such that none of them divides two of the others. The cardinality of the set is 21, so a(29)=21.
author: _John W. Layman_
extensions: More terms and additional comments from _Jud McCranie_, Jan 17 2001
